Your Whitsundays Sailing Adventure ‚Äî What to Expect
Step aboard Hammer, a true race-bred maxi yacht, and launch into a high-energy sailing experience unlike any other. With only 23 guests onboard, every moment is personal, immersive, and exhilarating.
(Please note this is subject to change based on weather conditions and tides)
Wake up to a yummy breakfast as you cruise to Tongue Bay. Take a scenic bushwalk to Hill Inlet Lookout for breathtaking views of Whitehaven Beach and the swirling sands of the inlet. Once you have perfected your shots, head down to spend a relaxing 3 hours on Whitehaven beach. Lunch is served back on board before you set sail to your two handpicked snorkel destinations. Once you are snorkelled out (if there is such a thing), head to another one of our favourite beach locations for sunset snacks before heading to your overnight anchorage.
But the fun doesn‚Äôt stop there! Enjoy the afternoon in Airlie, head back to your accommodation, freshen up and then join your new friends for an after-party with a reserved table, meal deals, and drink discounts!
Experience Hammer ‚Äî Ex-Racing Maxi Yacht
Sleek, performance-built ex-race yacht
Spacious open decks for sunbathing and socialising
Dorm-style accommodation (single & double beds) with fans and linen
Rain & sunshades, hammocks, yoga mats
Hot freshwater showers onboard
BYO alcohol welcome (no glass or red wine)
Three experienced and passionate crew members (skipper and two deckhands/hosts) to ensure a memorable experience.
All meals ‚Äì daily breakfast, morning tea, lunch, afternoon snacks, dinner & dessert.
Beverages ‚Äì tea, coffee, hot chocolate & filtered water (BYO alcohol & other beverages ‚Äì no glass bottles please).
Snorkelling equipment (mask, snorkel & wetsuit).
Comfortable bedding with a pillow, bed linen, and a fan.
All Marine Park fees.
What Prosail Guests Are Saying
FAQ About This Tour
Where do we meet?
Coral Sea Marina, Meeting Point C,¬† under the white umbrellas near Whitsunday JetSki Tours.
What should I bring?
Soft bag only (no wheels). Pack swimwear, a towel, sunscreen, sunglasses, a hat, light shoes, sweater, spray jacket, and personal toiletries.
Can I bring drinks?
Yes , Hammer is BYO (no glass or red wine). Filtered water is provided; bring a refillable bottle.
What if I can‚Äôt swim well?
We provide flotation devices, risk assessments, and nearby tender support at snorkel spots.
Can I Bring Large Luggage?
Large bags and suitcases cannot be taken on-board. Storage services are available at most accommodation locations in Airlie Beach.
